result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen K. Schwan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences Stephen K. Schwan to 5 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 3 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2  years. This sentence this is to be served concurrent to any other sentence that may be imposed. This sentence is to commence  FORTHWITH

Reserve Judge Davis presiding for Branch IV:  
[MK] case called at 1:22pm. 
Defendant Stephen K. Schwan in court, in custody, with Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court reviews excerpts from the transcript of the Sentencing hearing and the Court comments on its considerations given at the time of the Sentencing.  
The Court indicates that it did not rely on the incorrect information in making its sentencing decisions. The Court's Sentence would not have been any different. 
The Court denies the Defendant's Motion for Postconviction Relief.

Motion hearing on March 10, 2017 at 11:00 am.

On Defendant's 11/18/16 Motion for Post-Conviction Relief:
[JK] case called at 2:13 pm
Defendant Stephen K. Schwan in court, in custody, with Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court discusses with counsel that there is a clearly identified mis-statement of fact.  The Court concludes that Judge Davis needs to hear the Motion because only Judge Davis can give consideration as to whether this factual-information would have impacted his decision in imposing the sentence length. 
The Court will schedule an adjourned Motion Hearing; the Court declines Attorney Schoenfeldt's request to schedule the case before Judge Davis for resentencing-type of hearing because it is for Judge Davis to determine whether Mr. Schwan is entitled to a resentencing on this case.  If Judge Davis concludes that the Defendant is entitled to resentencing, Judge Davis will be available in Jefferson County on two dates later in that same month for the scheduling of any resentencing hearing.
The Court sets end-of-business on January 31st for the State to file a Response, if any. 
recess 2:25pm.

records.addlTxt:
Reserve Judge Mac Davis presiding for Branch IV

Case called at 10:34am [mo]
Defendant Stephen K. Schwan in court with attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "  GUILTY " entered; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Stephen K. Schwan guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
The Court finds for purposes of the surcharge there was one image

The Court sentences Stephen K. Schwan  to   5 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  3  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2  years. This sentence this is to be served concurrent to any other sentence that may be imposed. This sentence is to commence  FORTHWITH

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 

The Court gives  77   days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations per agent
--absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--psycho- sexual evaluation and follow through with any recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per agent
--to pay statutory costs


Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Statute 948.13 prohibition from employment or volunteer-work that involves children is imposed; penalties recited 
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 11:05am
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-08-2016 10:00 am
Arraignment at 04-08-2016 10:00 am
